alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 06 at 11:54AM PST until January 08 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 15 feet with dangerous rip currents. Highest surf near Point Conception. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches
